attributes.action: Investigation of menstrual changes after Covid jabs
attributes.additional_details: Common side effects of covid-19 vaccination listed by the UK’s Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency (MHRA) include a sore arm, fever, fatigue, and myalgia. Changes to periods and unexpected vaginal bleeding are not listed. More than 30 000 reports of these events had been made to MHRA’s yellow card surveillance scheme.
attributes.background: More research needs to be done to into why women may experience changes to their menstrual cycle after the vaccine and be made aware of any changes or future changes.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

We understand you'd like the Government to look into a possible link between covid-19 vaccination and changes to menstrual cycles. However, we're not sure exactly what action by the Government you'd want this research to lead to. The Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency (MHRA), not the Government, is responsible for producing information on possible side effects of covid-19 vaccinations.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. If you did start a new petition, we would need you to provide a full name, in line with our petitions standards.
